eu.cqse.check.abap

Class CallWsFunctionCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.base.EntityCheckBase
        • eu.cqse.check.abap.CallStatementCheckBase
          • eu.cqse.check.abap.CallWsFunctionCheck

  • @ACheck(name="Suspicious call of function modules WS_QUERY or WS_EXECUTE",
        description="The function modules `WS_QUERY` and `WS_EXECUTE` allow to execute on the presentation server. `WS_QUERY` queries the file parameters and environment variables on the presentation server. `WS_EXECUTE` starts a (non-SAP) program (for example, editor, table calculation, etc.) on the presentation server. Both functions are obsolete. The appropriate method from the global class `CL_GUI_FRONTEND_SERVICES` or the appropriate function module from function group `SFES` should be used instead.",
        groupName="Security",
        languages=ABAP,
        parameters=ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE)
public class CallWsFunctionCheck
extends CallStatementCheckBase
    Checks for calls of functions WS_QUERY and WS_EXECUTE. WS_QUERY queries the file parameters and environment variables on the presentation server. WS_EXECUTE starts a (non-SAP) program (for example, editor, table calculation, etc.) on the presentation server. Both functions are obsolete. The appropriate method from the global class CL_GUI_FRONTEND_SERVICES or the appropriate function module from function group SFES should be used instead.

      • processCallStatement

        protected void processCallStatement()
                             throws CheckException
        Processes the selected CALL ... statement entity. This method is only called from CallStatementCheckBase.processEntity(ShallowEntity) if the first token is the CALL keyword and the second token is of a type which is accepted by CallStatementCheckBase.isTargetedCallStatement(ETokenType).
